Title: Worse than ever
Author: Qu1nnie
Content:
Iâ€™m disappointed i canâ€™t rate 0 stars for this, as it deserves no rating. The app is worse than ever and buggy, being so full of corporate greed iâ€™m surprised you are able to see or understand anything beyond your selfish little world. Canâ€™t watch anything without having to reset the internet, login 10 times and then disappointedly watch the audio and video out of sync, laggy and terrible quality. 

Anyone who made the decision to release this app and push forward with it should be locked up and the key thrown away. Congratulations on ruining a countries sporting support, with one flick of a switch. I feel bad for anyone working on this project, and I apologise for you having to read this. But your â€˜higher-upsâ€™ are terrible greedy selfish disgraces to this Nation. They deserve to be known and all the hate directed on them rather than the frantically working coders who have been thrown unceremoniously into this. 

Have a terrible day

Yours truly,

New Zealand

Title: Useless
Author: Dirtypetenz
Content:
App performs poorly, looks good from a UI perspective but the back end is terrible.

Week before the biggest rugby event, letter arrives saying we canâ€™t watch due to the internet at our place (provided by spark who own Spark sport). Now this is an issue but not sparks sports, so I made arrangements to view at a mates place who has 100/20. So I know thatâ€™s good. This is where the troubles start. 

Picture quality is terrible,  stutters and looses picture all the time, the 3 dots of death (buffering) and audio issues, and thatâ€™s just so far. This company were not prepared to put development into this app or the back end and have been blaming everyone or thing for the issues. The overseas streaming is done by Akamai, who appear to know what they are doing but the app constantly freezes and crashes. Iâ€™ve turned the auto update on, deleted it and reinstalled it, then not used the app and used the website and got the same results.

I should have read the reviews that pointed out constant streaming issues with smaller events. I have no faith this will be fixed without the company ducking for cover, and anticipate a copy and paste reply or passive aggressive reply about this review. Check their Facebook page for more info about the app issues and streaming issues, but be aware, they are deleting peopleâ€™s comments. 

Poor effort spark sport, poor streaming and crashes has ruined the RWC for us all.

Title: Unreliable

Title: Very limited app
Author: hexeyman
Content:
Updated review
I reviewed this several months ago during the beta release and a free trial, giving it 2 out of 5. Coming back to it recently not much has changed.

On the plus side:
-Picture quality is good on my iPhone and laptop. There are occasional pauses for buffering but nothing serious with my 100mbs fibre connection. That is the plus points done with. 

On the negative side:
- There is no search function meaning it is difficult to find what you want quickly.
- There is no way to identify the sports and events of interest to you meaning the home page is dominated with irrelevant content.
- Sound consistently becomes out of sync with the picture. The longer the event the greater the difference. For example, at the end of a 2 hour Grand Prix this is a 5 to 10 second difference. Reloading the stream doesnâ€™t fix it.
- It is impossible to purchase access for individual sports events. You need to pay full price for everything even if you donâ€™t want it. Interested in a particular grand prix or football match but donâ€™t want to pay for the whole service? Tough. Pay for everything or get nothing. It is an outdated business model which doesnâ€™t fit a streaming service. 

I still cannot recommend this product. It needs significant improvements to deliver and consistent product and pricing model which welcomes those with a passing interest to watch instead of serving die hard fans.

Title: App is pointless
Author: teeelesssa
Content: Not recommended if you want to watch Rugby World Cup. Wasted money on this. Also it kept dropping off my casting options. So there were times where I couldnâ€™t stream to the tv had to watch it on my phone.

Title: Not a Good Experience
Author: eracode
Content:
Subscribed for RWC. Watching games on-demand at off-peak times, many times during a game the picture pixelates and freezes. Also the picture is continuously switching in and out of HD all though a game. Overall not a great experience.

Watching via ultrafast fibre, iPad Pro > Chromecast > 2018 LG OLED TV.

Spark Sport promised there would be an app for this TV so we paid for the app in good faith - then they reneged on their promise. Unimpressed.

Edit: Just watched our first live game - JPN v IRE. More pixelation, freezing, buffering. Very frustrating. About half the game was at less than HD resolution. Simply not good enough. Have changed rating from 2- to 1-star.
